maml:description.maml:para: Inserts one or more specified device drivers into all operating system images in the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcDriver -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Inserts one or more specified device drivers into all operating system images in the HPC cluster.
Adds a specified list of one or more nodes to one or more specified node groups.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcGroup -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Adds a specified list of one or more nodes to one or more specified node groups. You can specify the node groups by name or by identifier. You can specify the nodes either by name or by using HpcNode objects that you get with the Get-HpcNode cmdlet.
Loads one or more specified Windows image (.wim) files, and adds the operating system images from those files to the image store for the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcImage -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Loads one or more specified Windows image (.wim) files, and adds the operating system images from those files to the image store for the HPC cluster.
Adds the Internet SCSI (iSCSI) storage array at the specified management IP address to an HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcIScsiStorageArray -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Adds the iSCSI storage array at the specified management IP address to an HPC cluster. An iSCSI storage array is a computer, storage system, or appliance that provides storage resources over a network connection by using the iSCSI protocol. The nodes in an HPC cluster can use the iSCSI storage array to boot over a network connection, instead of requiring a local hard disk drive to serve as a system disk.
Adds one or more specified users or administrators to the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcMember -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Adds one or more specified users or administrators to the HPC cluster. If you do not specify a role, the Add-HpcMember cmdlet adds the specified accounts as users by default.
Adds a set of Windows Azure nodes to the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcNodeSet -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Adds the specified number of Windows Azure nodes with the specified virtual machine size to the HPC cluster by using the specified node template.
Adds a new resource pool on an HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcPool -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Adds a new resource pool on an HPC cluster.
Creates a new task and adds it to the specified job.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcTask -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Creates a new task and adds it to the specified job on an HPC cluster.

You can use the Add-HpcTask cmdlet on jobs that you have not yet submitted, jobs that you submitted that are currently waiting in the queue, jobs that are already running, jobs that have failed, or jobs that have been canceled. You cannot add tasks to a job that has finished. When the resources that the job scheduler allocated to the job are available, the task begins to run.
Adds the custom diagnostic tests that the specified XML file defines to the set of diagnostic tests that administrators can run on the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Add-HpcTest -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Adds the custom diagnostic tests that the specified XML file defines to the set of diagnostic tests that administrators can run on the HPC cluster. For information about creating custom diagnostic tests, see the Diagnostics Extensibility in Windows HPC Server 2008 R2 Step-by-Step Guide (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=177604).
Assigns or reapplies a node template to one or more specified nodes. As a result, the cmdlet rebuilds the nodes with the information from the node template.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Assign-HpcNodeTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Assigns or reapplies a node template to one or more specified nodes. This cmdlet is equivalent to the clicking a node and then clicking Assign Node Template in HPC Cluster Manager.
Copies a job template.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Copy-HpcJobTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Creates a new job template by copying an existing job template. You can use the name of the existing job template or use an HpcJobTemplate object to specify the job template that you want to copy.
Creates a new node template by making a copy of an existing node template.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Copy-HpcNodeTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Creates a new node template by making a copy of an existing node template.
Saves information about the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) reservations for the specified nodes to the specified XML file, or for all of the nodes in the cluster if none are specified.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcDHCPReservations -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Saves information about the DHCP reservations for the specified node to the specified XML file, or for all of the nodes in the cluster if none are specified. You can specify the nodes by name or by HpcNode objects that represent the nodes.

DHCP reservations of IP addresses are based on media access control (MAC) addresses. Each reserved IP address is linked to the MAC address of the network adapter to which that IP address will be assigned.
Saves information about a job in an XML file.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcJob -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Exports the specified job to an XML file. You can then import the file by specifying the file in the JobFile parameter of the New-HpcJob cmdlet to create a new job based on the exported job.
Exports the specified job template to an XML file.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcJobTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Exports the specified job template to an XML file. You can specify the job template by name or as an HpcJobTemplate object. You can edit the XML file to change settings as needed, and then import it to create a new job template based on the exported job template.
Exports the specified set of metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts to an XML file.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcMetric -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Exports the specified set of metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts to an XML file. You can specify the metrics that you want to export by any combination of the names of the metrics, the locations where the metrics are generated, and the categories for the metrics. If you do not specify any names, locations, or categories, the Export-HpcMetric cmdlet exports all of the metrics for the HPC Cluster.
Creates an XML-based representation of a node template and stores it in a file.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcNodeTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Creates an XML-based representation of a node template and stores it in a file.
Exports information about the specified compute nodes to an XML file.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcNodeXml -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Exports information about the specified compute nodes to an XML file. You can specify the compute nodes by name or by using HpcNode objects that you retrieve with the Get-HpcNode cmdlet.

Copies the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) log files that contain the traces for the specified service-oriented architecture (SOA) session from each of the compute nodes to a single location so that you can view the log files with Service Trace Viewer.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcSoaSessionTrace -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Copies the WCF log files that contain the traces for the specified SOA session from each of the compute nodes to a single location so that you can view the log file with Service Trace Viewer. You can specify the SOA session by specifying the identifier for the SOA session or by specifying the HpcJob object for the service job for the session. This cmdlet performs the same action that occurs when you click Collect Trace in the Job Management view in HPC Cluster Manager.
Exports the settings for the specified task to a task XML file.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcTask -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Exports the settings for the specified task to a task XML file. You can specify the task for which you want to export the settings by using the job identifier and task identifier for the task or by using an HpcTask object. After you export the task XML file, you can then specify the task XML file in the TaskFile parameter of the Add-HpcTask cmdlet to add a new task to a job with the same settings as the exported task.
Exports the test results for the specified diagnostic test run to the specified directory.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Export-HpcTestResult -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Exports the test results for the specified diagnostic test run to the specified directory. You can specify the diagnostic test run for which you want to export the test results by specifying the identifier for the test run or the HpcTestResult object for the test run.

The test results can consist of several files, including a Poststep.result file that concatenates the standard output and standard error streams from all of the nodes in the diagnostic test; a PostStepResult.xml file that contains the results of the diagnostic test, which is structured according to the Diagnostic Test Step Result XML Schema; and a Report.html file that contains the results of the diagnostic test that is formatted as an HTML page that HPC Cluster Manager displays on the Result tab for the test results.
Gets an overview of some metrics for the specified HPC cluster, including the number of nodes, jobs, and tasks in various states on the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcClusterOverview -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets an overview of some metrics for the specified HPC cluster, including the number of nodes, jobs, and tasks in various states on the HPC cluster.
Gets the cluster-wide properties for the specified HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcClusterProperty -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the cluster-wide properties for the specified HPC cluster. Cluster-wide properties include parameters, environment variables, installation credentials, credentials to use for sending email notifications, the naming series for new compute nodes, and the Windows Deployment Services mode. If you do not specify any parameters, this cmdlet get the values for all of these items.
Gets one or more specified device drivers, or gets all of the device drivers for the HPC cluster if you do not specify any device drivers.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcDriver -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets one or more specified device drivers, or gets all of the device drivers for the HPC cluster if you do not specify any device drivers. You specify the device drivers by using the file names of the setup information (.inf) files for the device drivers.
Gets the specified list of one or more node groups.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcGroup -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets a list of one or more node groups, specified by the names or identifiers of the node groups. If you do not specify a node group, the Get-HpcGroup cmdlet gets all of the node groups for the HPC cluster.
Gets one or more specified operating system images, or gets all of the operating system images in the image store for the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcImage -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets one or more specified operating system images, or gets all of the operating system images in the image store for the HPC cluster. You can specify the operating system images by name or by the name of the Windows Image (.wim) file that contains the image.

Gets information about or HpcIScsiStorageArray objects for the Internet SCSI (iSCSI) storage arrays with the specified names and management IP addresses, or it gets all of the iSCSI storage arrays for the HPC cluster if no names or management IP addresses are specified.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcIScsiStorageArray -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets information about or HpcIScsiStorageArray objects for the iSCSI storage arrays with the specified names and management IP addresses, or it gets all of the iSCSI storage arrays for the HPC cluster if no names or management IP addresses are specified.
Gets a list of jobs that match the specified criteria, or gets a list of jobs that are running on one or more specified nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcJob -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets a list of jobs that match the specified values for the submission time, job identifier, name, owner, project, state, or scheduler properties for the job. By default, this form of the Get-HpcJob cmdlet only gets jobs that have a state of queued or running and that belong to the current user, unless you specify the job identifier, the state, or the owner of the jobs that you want to get. Alternatively, the Get-HpcJob cmdlet gets a list of jobs that are running on one or more specified nodes.
Gets the credentials for submitting jobs.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcJobCredential -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the certificate credentials for submitting jobs. Returns a list of HPC soft card certificates with their thumbprints and the dates for which they are valid. For most users, this list will have only one entry. If none exist, nothing is returned.
Gets the job history data for all finished, canceled, and failed jobs for the specified time period. You can export this information to a database and create and run reports on the information.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcJobHistory -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the job history data for all finished, canceled, and failed jobs for the specified time period. You can export this information to a database and create and run reports on the information. The time period is on and after the specified start date and time and before the specified end date and time.
You can schedule this cmdlet to run daily and export the job history to a database. You can then use this database to track job history.
Gets information for one or more specified job templates, or for all job templates if none are specified.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcJobTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets information for one or more specified job templates, or for all job templates if none are specified.

If you do not save the HpcJobTemplate object that this cmdlet returns in a variable or redirect the object to another cmdlet, Get-HpcJobTemplate displays information about the job templates. This information includes the name and description for the job template and the dates and times in local time that the job template was created and last changed.
Gets the access control list (ACL) for the specified job template.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcJobTemplateAcl -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the ACL for the specified job template. You can specify the job template by name or as an HpcJobTemplate object. After you get the ACL for the job template, you can apply the ACL to a different job template to copy permissions between templates. You can also change the ACL by using the .NET application programming interfaces (APIs) and then apply the modified ACL to a job template.

Gets one or more specified users and administrators for the HPC cluster, or gets all members of one or more specified roles. If you do not specify any users, administrators, or roles, the Get-HpcMember cmdlet gets all of the users and administrators for the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcMember -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets one or more specified users and administrators for the HPC cluster, or gets all members of one or more specified roles. If you do not specify any users, administrators, or roles, the Get-HpcMember cmdlet gets all of the users and administrators for the HPC cluster.
Gets the specified set of metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcMetric -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the specified set of metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts. You can specify the metrics that you want to get by any combination of the names of the metrics, the locations where the metrics are generated, and the categories for the metrics. If you do not specify any names, locations, or categories, the Get-HpcMetric cmdlet gets all of the metrics for the HPC cluster.
Gets the current value of the specified metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcMetricValue -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets the current value of the specified set of metrics for the specified nodes that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts.

You can specify the metric values that you want to get by any combination of the names of the metrics, the locations where the metrics are generated, and the categories for the metrics. You can specify the nodes for which you want to get the metric values by specifying the node name or an HpcNode object for the NodeName or Node parameters, respectively.

If you do not specify any names, locations, or categories, the Get-HpcMetricValue cmdlet gets the values of all of the metrics for the specified nodes, or for all of nodes in the HPC cluster if no nodes are specified.
Gets the values for a specified metric during the specified time period.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcMetricValueHistory -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the values for a specified metric during the specified time period. HPC Cluster Manager uses these metrics in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts. The time period is the period after the specified start date and time and before the specified end date and time.
You can specify the nodes for which you want to get the metric values by specifying the node name or by specifying an HpcNode object for the NodeName or Node parameters, respectively.

If you do not specify any metric names, the Get-HpcMetricValueHistory cmdlet gets the values for all of the metrics for the specified nodes, or for all of nodes in the HPC cluster if no nodes are specified.
Gets the network interfaces on the head node that have one or more specified names or one or more specified types.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcNetworkInterface -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the network interfaces on the head node that have one or more specified names or one or more specified types. If you do not specify any names or types, the Get-HpcNetworkInterface cmdlet gets all of the network interfaces on the head node.
Gets the current network topology for the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcNetworkTopology -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets the current network topology for the HPC cluster. The network topology can be Enterprise, Private, EnterprisePrivate, PrivateApplication, or EnterprisePrivateApplication. These topologies are defined as follows:
Enterprise: All nodes are connected only to an enterprise network. You only need one network adapter on the head node for this topology.
Private: The compute nodes are isolated on a private network. You need two network adapters on the head node for this topology.
EnterprisePrivate: All nodes are connected to both enterprise and private networks. You need two network adapters on the head node for this topology.
PrivateApplication: The compute nodes are isolated on private and application networks. You need three network adapters on the head node for this topology.
EnterprisePrivateApplication: All nodes are connected to enterprise, private, and application networks. You need three network adapters on the head node for this topology.
Gets a list of one or more nodes in the HPC cluster that meet the specified criteria.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcNode -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets a list of one or more nodes in the HPC cluster that meet the specified criteria for name, group, location, node template, node health, or node state.
Retrieves the history of changes to the state of the nodes in the HPC cluster for the specified time period.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcNodeStateHistory -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Retrieves the history of changes to the state of the nodes in the HPC cluster for the specified time period. The time period is the period after the specified start date and time and before the specified end date and time.
You can schedule this cmdlet to run daily and export the history of node states to a database. You can then use this database to track node availability.
Gets one or more specified node templates, or gets all of the node templates for an HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcNodeTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets one or more specified node templates, or gets all of the node templates for an HPC cluster. You can specify the node templates by name. If you do not specify any node templates, the Get-HpcNodeTemplate cmdlets gets all of the node templates for the specified HPC cluster.
Gets one or more specified operations, or gets the operations that meet the specified criteria.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcOperation -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets one or more specified operations, or gets the operations that meet the specified criteria. If you do not redirect the HpcOperation objects that are the output of the Get-HpcOperation cmdlet to another cmdlet or save the objects to variables, the Get-HpcOperation cmdlet displays information about the operation such as the name, status, and last update time for the operation.
Gets the log and substeps for the specified operation.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcOperationLog -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets the log and substeps for the specified operation.
Gets the pool specified by the Name parameter.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcPool -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets the pool specified by the Name parameter. If no pool exists with the name specified, an error results. If no pool name is specified, a list of the available pools is returned.
Gets a specified task or subtask for the specified job, or gets a list of all tasks for the specified job.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcTask -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets a specified task or subtask for the specified job, or gets a list of all tasks for the specified job. You can cancel, requeue, or submit the task that you get with this cmdlet by using the Cancel, Requeue, or Submit method of the HpcTask object that the cmdlet returns.
Gets one or more specified diagnostic tests, or gets all of the diagnostic tests for the HPC cluster if you do not specify any tests.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcTest -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets one or more specified diagnostic tests, or gets all of the diagnostic tests for the HPC cluster if you do not specify any tests. You can specify diagnostic tests by their aliases.
Gets detailed information about a specified diagnostic test, including the metadata, parameters, environment variables, and commands for the test.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcTestDetail -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets detailed information about a specified diagnostic test, including the metadata, parameters, environment variables, and commands for the test. You can specify the diagnostic test by using the alias for the test or by using an HpcTestCase object for the test. To get an HpcTestCase object for a test, use the Get-HpcTest cmdlet.
Gets the test runs for the specified diagnostic test that meet the specified criteria.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcTestResult -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Gets the test runs for the specified diagnostic test that meet the specified criteria. You can use either the alias or an HpcTestCase object for a diagnostic test to specify it.

If you do not specify a diagnostic test but do specify other criteria, the cmdlet gets the test runs for all of the diagnostic tests that meet the specified criteria. If you specify a diagnostic test without specifying other criteria, the cmdlet gets all of the test runs for the specified diagnostic test. If you specify neither a diagnostic test nor any other criteria, the cmdlet gets all test runs for all diagnostic tests for the HPC cluster.

Gets detailed information about the results of a specific run for a diagnostic test, including the start and end times for the test, the values specified for the parameters of the test, and the results of the test on each node in the test.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Get-HpcTestResultDetail -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Gets detailed information about the results of a specific run for a diagnostic test, including the start and end times for the test, the values specified for the parameters of the test, and the results of the test on each node in the test.

You can specify the test run for which you want to view detailed results by specifying the identifier of the test run or by specifying an HpcTestResult object for the run. Use the Get-HpcTestResult cmdlet to get the identifier of the runs for a diagnostic test or to get the HpcTestResult object for a specific run.
Imports a job template from an XML file.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Import-HpcJobTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Imports a job template from an XML file, and as a result creates a new job template or overwrites an existing job template.
Imports metrics from the specified XML file to create new metrics or overwrite existing metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Import-HpcMetric -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Imports metrics from the specified XML file to create new metrics or overwrite existing metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts.
Imports one or more node template XML files, and then creates new node templates or overwrites existing node templates based on the information in the node template XML files.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Import-HpcNodeTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Imports one or more node template XML files, and then creates new node templates or overwrites existing node templates based on the information in the node template XML files. The names of the node template XML files without the file extensions serve as the names of the node templates.
Imports nodes from the lists of nodes in one or more specified node XML files, and adds the nodes to the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Import-HpcNodeXml -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Imports nodes from the lists of nodes in one or more specified node XML files, and adds the nodes to the HPC cluster.
Runs the specified diagnostic tests on one or more specified nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Invoke-HpcTest -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Runs the specified diagnostic tests on one or more specified nodes. You can specify the diagnostic test by using the alias or by specifying the HpcTestCase object for the test. You can specify the nodes by using the names or by specifying the HpcNode objects for the nodes, or you can use the name of a node group that contains the nodes.
Creates a new node group with the specified name and description.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help New-HpcGroup -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Creates a new node group with the specified name and description.
Creates a new operating system image and adds it to the image store for the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help New-HpcImage -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Creates a new operating system image from the installation directory or installation media for the operating system or from the operating system on the specified node, and then adds the image to the image store for the HPC cluster.
Creates a new job, or creates a new copy of an existing job.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help New-HpcJob -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Creates a new job on the specified cluster by using the settings that the parameters or job XML files specify, or creates a new copy of an existing job.
Creates a new node template and optionally associates an operating system image with the node template.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help New-HpcNodeTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Creates a new node template and optionally associates an operating system image with the node template.
Generates a new HPC soft card certificate.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help New-HpcSoftCard -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Generates a public key pair, obtains a certificate from the certificate authority, and places the certificate in the local certificate store.

maml:navigationLink.maml:linkText: New Feature Evaluation Guide for Windows HPC Server 2008 R2 SP2

maml:description.maml:para: Removes one or more specified device drivers.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcDriver -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Removes one or more specified device drivers. You specify the device drivers by using either HpcDriver objects or the names of the setup information (.inf) files for the device drivers. Do not include the paths for the .inf files.
Removes the association between one or more specified node groups and one or more specified nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcGroup -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Removes the association between one or more specified node groups and one or more specified nodes.
If you do not specify any nodes, the Remove-HpcGroup cmdlet removes the association between the specified node groups and all of the nodes that the node groups contain, then deletes the node groups.

If you specify all of the nodes in a specified node group, the Remove-HpcGroup cmdlet removes the association between the specified node group and all of the nodes, but does not delete the node group.
Removes one or more specified operating system images from the image store for the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcImage -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Removes one or more specified operating system images from the image store for the HPC cluster. You can specify the operating system images by specifying HpcImage objects for the images or the names of the Windows Image (.wim) files that contain the images.
Removes the specified Internet SCSI (iSCSI) storage array from the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcIScsiStorageArray -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Removes the specified iSCSI storage array from the HPC cluster. You can only remove an iSCSI storage array from the HPC cluster if no nodes are currently deployed with the iSCSI storage array.
Deletes the cached credentials for one or more specified users that the job scheduler uses to submit jobs.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcJobCredential -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Deletes the cached credentials for one or more specified users that the job scheduler uses to submit jobs. If you do not specify a user name, the cmdlet deletes the credential of the user who ran the cmdlet.
Deletes a job template from the specified cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcJobTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Deletes a job template from the specified cluster. You can specify the job template that you want to delete either by name or by passing an HpcJobTemplate object to the Remove-JobTemplate cmdlet.
Removes one or more specified members from the HPC cluster or from the specified roles.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcMember -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Removes one or more specified members from the HPC cluster or from the specified roles. The roles in an HPC cluster are user and administrator.
Removes one or more specified metrics from the set of metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcMetric -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Removes one or more specified metrics from the set of metrics that HPC Cluster Manager uses in the heat maps for the nodes and the monitoring charts.
Removes the entry for one or more nodes from the HPC cluster management database.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcNode -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Removes the entry for one or more nodes from the HPC cluster management database. This cmdlet does not delete Microsoft HPC Pack on the nodes. To delete a node completely, you need to uninstall Microsoft HPC Pack as well. You can use HPC Cluster Manager to add nodes that you deleted back to the cluster. HPC Cluster Manager is able to rediscover these deleted nodes.
Removes a set of Windows Azure nodes from an HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcNodeSet -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Removes the set of Windows Azure nodes that are associated with the specified node template from an HPC cluster.
Deletes one or more specified node templates from the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcNodeTemplate -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Deletes one or more specified node templates from the HPC cluster.
Removes the specified HPC pool.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcPool -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Removes the specified HPC pool. Returns an error if the pool is used in one or more templates. You can use the Force option to force removal of the pools, resetting the template or templates to use the default pool.
Deletes the cached credentials for one or more specified users that service-oriented architecture (SOA) clients use to create SOA sessions.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcSoaCredential -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Deletes the cached credentials for one or more specified users that SOA clients use to create SOA sessions. If you do not specify a user name, the cmdlet deletes the credential of the user who ran the cmdlet.
Removes the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) log files that contain the traces for the specified service-oriented architecture (SOA) session from the compute nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcSoaSessionTrace -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Removes the WCF log files that contain the traces for the specified SOA session from the compute nodes. You can specify the SOA session by specifying the identifier for the SOA session or by specifying the HpcJob object for the service job for the session. This cmdlet performs the same action that occurs when you click Delete Trace in the Job Management view in HPC Cluster Manager.
Removes the diagnostic test with the specified alias from the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcTest -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Removes the diagnostic test with the specified alias from the HPC cluster. You can use an alias or an HPCTestCase object to specify the diagnostic test to remove. Use the Get-HpcTest cmdlet to view the aliases of diagnostic tests on the HPC cluster or to get the HPCTestCase object for a specific test.
Clears the cached credentials that the HPC Diagnostics Service uses to run diagnostic tests.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcTestCredential -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Clears the cached credentials that the HPC Diagnostics Service uses to run diagnostic tests. These credentials are used to run the clusrun commands that run each phase of the diagnostic test if the user does not specify credentials when running the test.
Clears the alert icon for the specified diagnostic test runs, or for all diagnostic test runs if none are specified.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Remove-HpcTestResultAlert -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Clears the alert icon for the specified diagnostic test runs, or for all diagnostic test runs if none are specified. You can specify a test run by providing the identifier of the test run or by providing an HpcTestResult object for the test run.

The alert icon appears for failed test runs in the list of test runs under Diagnostics in HPC Cluster Manager. Alert icons also appear for the nodes on which the diagnostic test failed under Node Management in HPC Cluster Manager. An alert icon for a node clears only when you clear the alert icons for all of the test runs that failed on that node.
Copies the base-node operating system image from the specified Windows image (.wim) file to the specified Internet SCSI (iSCSI) storage arrays.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Replicate-HpcImage -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Copies the base-node operating system image from the specified Windows image (.wim) file to the specified iSCSI storage arrays.
Restarts one or more nodes that are already turned on.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Restart-HpcNode -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Restarts one or more nodes that are already turned on. By default, this cmdlet sends a shutdown command to the operating system, but computer vendors can change the configuration to add commands based on Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI).
Sets the specified cluster-wide properties.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcClusterProperty -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Sets the specified cluster-wide properties. Cluster-wide properties include parameters, environment variables, installation credentials, credentials to use for sending email notifications, the naming series for new compute nodes, and the Windows Deployment Services mode.
Changes the name or description of the specified node group.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcGroup -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Changes the name or description of the specified node group.
Sets the name, description, or IP address of the specified Internet SCSI (iSCSI) storage array for an HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcIScsiStorageArray -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Sets the name, description, or IP address of the specified iSCSI storage array for an HPC cluster.
Sets the properties of the specified job.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcJob -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Sets the properties of the specified job for the specified cluster.
Sets the credentials for submitting jobs.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcJobCredential -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Sets the credentials for submitting jobs. The cmdlet stores these credentials in the credential cache of the user who ran the cmdlet.
Sets the access control list (ACL) on the specified job template.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcJobTemplateAcl -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Sets the ACL on the specified job template. You can get an ACL for another job template by using the Get-HpcJobTemplateAcl cmdlet and then set that ACL on another job template to copy permissions between job templates. You can also modify the ACL before you apply it to another job template by using .NET application programming interfaces (APIs).
Sets the network topology and the properties of all of the network interfaces for the HPC cluster.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcNetwork -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Sets the network topology and the properties of all of the network interfaces for the HPC cluster. Five network topologies are available: Enterprise, Private, EnterprisePrivate, PrivateApplication, EnterprisePrivateApplication. You can set the properties for three types of network interfaces: Enterprise, Private, and Application. You can set different properties depending on the type of the network interface.
Changes the properties for one or more nodes, including the description, data center, rack, chassis, location, roles, and product key for the nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcNode -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Changes the properties for one or more nodes, including the description, data center, rack, chassis, location, roles, and product key for the nodes.
Sets the state of one or more nodes to online, offline, or rejected.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcNodeState -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Sets the state of one or more nodes to online, offline, or rejected.
Sets the weight on an HPC pool.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcPool -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Sets the weight on the specified HPC pool. Returns an error if the specified pool does not exist, or if the specified weight is less than 0 or greater than 999,999.
Sets the credentials for creating service-oriented architecture (SOA) sessions.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcSoaCredential -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Sets the credentials for creating SOA sessions. The cmdlet stores these credentials in the credential cache of the user who ran the cmdlet.
Sets the properties for a specified task.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcTask -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Sets the properties for a specified task. You can specify a task by using the job identifier and task identifier for the task or by using an HpcTask object for the task. You can only change the properties for a task that is in the configuring state.
Sets the credentials for running diagnostic tests.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Set-HpcTestCredential -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Sets the credentials for running diagnostic tests. The cmdlet stores these credentials in the credential cache of the user who ran the cmdlet. These credentials are used to run the clusrun commands that run each phase of the diagnostic test if the user does not specify credentials when running the test.
Turns off one or more nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Shutdown-HpcNode -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Turns off one or more nodes. If you do not have an Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) script that your computer vendor configured, you may not be able to start the node again remotely. By default, this cmdlet sends a shutdown command to the operating system, but computer vendors can change the configuration to add IPMI-based commands.
Turns on one or more nodes using an Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) script.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Start-HpcNode -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Turns on one or more nodes using preconfigured Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) script. Your computer vendor should have configured the IPMI script for your computer. If the IPMI script is not configured, Start-HpcNode generates an error.
Starts a set of Windows Azure nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Start-HpcNodeSet -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Starts the set of Windows Azure nodes that use the specified node template. When you start a set of nodes, you deploy a set of role instances for the nodes in Windows Azure.
Cancels one or more specified jobs.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Stop-HpcJob -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Cancels one or more specified jobs. You can specify the job by using the identifiers or the HpcJob objects for the jobs. You can specify that you want to cancel the job immediately, without using the grace period for task cancelation and without running the node release task. You can also specify that the state of the job after it is canceled should be Finished instead of Canceled, and you can specify an error message to explain why you canceled the jobs.

When you cancel a job, the job scheduler removes the job from the job queue if the job is waiting to run. If the job is running, the scheduler stops the tasks that are running, and it frees the resources that those tasks were using so that they can be allocated to another job.
Only an administrator or the owner of the job can cancel a job.
Stops a set of Windows Azure nodes.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Stop-HpcNodeSet -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Stop the set of Windows Azure nodes that use the specified node template. When you stop a set of nodes, you remove the set of role instances in Windows Azure and reset the state of the nodes to Not Deployed.
Cancels the specified operation and makes the best possible attempt to revert the operation, if the operation is still running.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Stop-HpcOperation -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Cancels the specified operation and makes the best possible attempt to revert the operation, if the operation is still running.
Cancels the specified task or subtask.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Stop-HpcTask -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Cancels the specified task or subtask. You can specify a task or subtask by specifying an HpcTask object for the task or subtask, or by specifying the job, task, and subtask identifiers.

When you cancel a task or subtask, the job scheduler removes the task or subtask from the queue if the task or subtask is waiting to run. If the task or subtask is running, the scheduler stops the task or subtask and frees the resources that it was using so that they can be allocated to other jobs.
Only an administrator or the owner of the job that contains a task or subtask can cancel the task or subtask.
Cancels the specified diagnostic test if it is still running.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Stop-HpcTestResult -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Cancels the specified diagnostic test run if it is still running. You can specify the test run identifier or an HpcTestResult object for the diagnostic test to cancel it. If the diagnostic test run is not running, an error occurs.
Submits or requeues one or more specified jobs to the HPC cluster that you want to run the jobs.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Submit-HpcJob -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.

Submits or requeues one or more specified jobs to the HPC cluster that you want to run the jobs. You can use either the job identifiers or HpcJob objects to specify the jobs. You can resubmit jobs that have a state of canceled or failed.
Validates that the head node of the HPC cluster can communicate with the specified Internet SCSI (iSCSI) storage array.
For information about the parameters for this cmdlet, additional remarks, and examples, type: Get-Help Validate-HpcIScsiStorageArray -online.
To download a Help file for all of the cmdlets that this product provides, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=270170.
Validates that the head node of the HPC cluster can communicate with the specified iSCSI storage array.
